alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Peoria; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 2:59PM CDT until March 31 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Marshall County in central Illinois... Woodford County in central Illinois... Northeastern Tazewell County in central Illinois... Southeastern Peoria County in central Illinois... * Until 345 PM CDT. * At 259 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near East Peoria, or near Peoria, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Metamora around 310 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Roanoke, Washburn and Minonk. This includes the following highways... Interstate 155 between mile markers 30 and 31. Interstate 39 between mile markers 17 and 27. Interstate 474 between mile markers 5 and 14. Interstate 74 between mile markers 89 and 106. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Illinois.
